title: What is Lethality?
body:
>Well, my theory was proven wrong, which kind of stinks in my opinion, but I'll live with it. Better off knowing the truth. See Edit below.

Someone please correct me if I am wrong, but Lethality seems to me to be **Base Armor Penetration** 

This would essentially be the opposite of what Last Whisper {{item:3035}} offers, **Bonus Armor Penetration**

Base Armor Penetration reduces the targets armor based on their current level, and Bonus Armor Penetration reduces the targets armor based on their items, runes, masteries, abilities, and/or buffs. 

This means Base Armor Penetration, now called Lethality, is particularly strong at countering champions who do not build armor, such as ADCs, but is weak against champions who do, such as Tanks. 

The intention of this is to make items that currently offer Armor Penetration {{item:3147}} {{item:3142}} less effective in the hands of ADCs, and giving them back to Assassins, as intended. 

I believe that {{item:3156}} is also having it's Armor Penetration replaced by Lethality, but I'm not sure that ADCs were abusing this so much. It may have still been an issue for Bruisers, or maybe it is just a result of {{item:3134}}'s changes. 

To my knowledge, {{item:3035}}, and the items it builds into will retain their Bonus Armor Penetration. 

I'm curious about what effects this may or may not have on runes, masteries, and champion specific abilities that offer Armor Penetration as well.

***
**Edit:**

Someone commented on another post with this. 

>Lethality is still armor pen.

>Its .4x + ((.6xy)/18) --------(Yes I know order of operations makes a lot of that unnecessary...its for clarity)

>Where x = total lethality and y = target champion level.

>Its exactly like old armor pen, but 60% of it scales with level rather than being part of the base.

~~If anyone can help to confirm or deny this I'd appreciate it. ~~

Lethality is a nerf to early game armor pen, but a buff for late game. That's all you need to see it as.
Imagine zed late game with 1000 AD and full armor pen... Because that Zed buff has logic in it...

What? His ult passive doesn't match his current w passive until he kills a target with around 800 AD. I wouldn't call that broke, just forces the Zed to get kills or fall more behind than he currently does. Unless you're talking about something else.
he gains perma AD from kills, PBE information. I don't know the skill names, but it's probly from ult, so he'll probly have ~1000 AD at 40th min and nobody will have a chance to stop him.
It doesn't stack, it only takes a percentage of the highest AD target you've killed during the game. It's definitely a nerf in most cases.
What kind of a nerf? Gaining more AD? Take % from a 900 AD Jhin and say it's a nerf... please...

Jhin is the only case where Zed can possibly reach the value of %increase AD that his current W passive has. 

He gets less AD in almost every case. It's a nerf. Why argue?
I'm sure it's a nerf... Later on Life he'll be a monster...
